summary: The BMW N73 engine, produced from 2003 to 2016, was the world's first production V12 engine to feature gasoline direct injection. It improved upon its predecessor, the M73, by incorporating dual overhead camshafts, double-VANOS variable valve timing, and Valvetronic variable valve lift. The N73 has a 60° V12 configuration with displacements of 6.0 L and 6.7 L, featuring a bore of 89 mm and 92 mm, and a stroke of 80 mm and 84.6 mm. It runs on petrol and succeeded by the BMW N74 engine.
